page.title: 04KILDRUMMY SCHOOL
page.content: The earlest records of the school are in the church session records of 1803, although these suggest that the school had been built prior to that date. At one time there were 90+ pupils, in three classrooms. The curriculum included latin greek, book keeping and Domestic science. The same building is still used with a small part added and the old part modernised and very attractively furnished. The three rooms are now classroom general purposes room and kitchen/ dining room. It can accommodate 19 pupils in the p1-5 range. The curriculum now includes Art Music Drama P.E and Home Economics. There is only one full time teacher At P6 the children traval 7 miles to Alford to complete their education The general purposes room is hired for meetings.
